{{cpp/experimental/fs/path/title|begin|end}}
{{cpp/experimental/fs/path/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|since=fs_ts|1=
iterator begin() const;
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=fs_ts|1=
iterator end() const;
}}
{{dcl end}}

@1@ Returns an iterator to the first element of the path. If the path is empty, the returned iterator is equal to {{lc|end()}}.
@2@ Returns an iterator one past the last element of the path. Dereferencing this iterator is undefined behavior.

The sequence denoted by this pair of iterators consists of the following:
@1@ {{spar|root-name}} (if any).
@2@ {{spar|root-directory}} (if any).
@3@ Sequence of {{spar|file-name}}s, omitting any directory separators.
@4@ If there is a directory separator after the last {{spar|file-name}} in the path, the last element before the end iterator is a fictitious {{spar|dot}} file name.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
@1@ Iterator to the first element of the path.
@2@ Iterator one past the end of the path.

{{cpp/impldef exception}}

===Example===
{{example|code=
#include &lt;experimental/filesystem&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
namespace fs = std::experimental::filesystem;

int main()
{
    fs::path p = "C:\\users\\abcdef\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\";
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Examining the path " &lt;&lt; p &lt;&lt; " through iterators gives\n";
    for (auto&amp; e : p)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; e &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
Examining the path "C:\users\abcdef\AppData\Local\Temp\" through iterators gives
"C:"
"/"
"users"
"abcdef"
"AppData"
"Local"
"Temp"
"."
}}
